name: Alan Stamm
reply: I've been a daily reader for 50 years, and am now thoroughly disgusted with the way the Sun is becoming ever more similar to supermarket tabloids, displaying bias against any and all who do not emulate its chest thumping liberalism, ignoring and castigating at every opportunity.

comments.name: Erika Clerk
comments.reply: Thank you I think younger readers want to interact with more of these stories instead of being passive consumers of whatever the nyt deems as correct. Top down media is dying Social networks are popular because they are interactive and feel more bidirectional
